context: I live 30 miles from the cape and get to experience these launches just by walking out my front door and looking to the east. It never ceases to amaze me how SpaceX has nailed rocket launches down to a methodical science. Sadly I don’t feel the same “wow factor” that I did when the STS program was still in effect but hey at least now I get to see launches almost on a weekly basis.

replies.context:
I'm jealous.  That's one heck of a porch view, 407.

I have shown my friends some of the UFO's I see travelling through the sky every night, but they say they are only airplanes. However if I can't identify them they're UFO's to me.

People seem to have this need to believe in extraterrestrial life and/or supernatural stuff.  I have a friend who ALWAYS jumps to "UFO" or "Ghosts" any time something happens he doesn't understand.  Once he swore it had to be an "alien spaceship."  When I researched it and showed him the news report that what he saw, in the same location at the same time was a spent Russian rocket, he denied it - insisting it HAD to be aliens.  You just have to shake your head at people like that and move on.  If they are happy believing in the LEAST likely explanation, then I guess it doesn't hurt anybody.

replies.context: I'm more concerned about the amount of space junk than I am aliens.

then I guess it doesn't hurt anybody.
YES, it does. Remember, they get to vote.
